column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=L. Frank Baum
#Text=Santa Claus lives in the Laughing Valley , where stands the big , rambling castle in which his toys are manufactured .
#Text=His workmen , selected from the ryls , knooks , pixies and fairies , live with him , and every one is as busy as can be from one year 's end to another .
#Text=It is called the Laughing Valley because everything there is happy and gay .

#Text=The brook chuckles to itself as it leaps rollicking between its green banks ; the wind whistles merrily in the trees ; the sunbeams dance lightly over the soft grass , and the violets and wild flowers look smilingly up from their green nests .
#Text=To laugh one needs to be happy ; to be happy one needs to be content .
#Text=And throughout the Laughing Valley of Santa Claus contentment reigns supreme .
#Text=On one side is the mighty Forest of Burzee .
#Text=At the other side stands the huge mountain that contains the Caves of the Daemons .
#Text=And between them the Valley lies smiling and peaceful .

#Text=One would thing that our good old Santa Claus , who devotes his days to making children happy , would have no enemies on all the earth ; and , as a matter of fact , for a long period of time he encountered nothing but love wherever he might go .
#Text=But the Daemons who live in the mountain caves grew to hate Santa Claus very much , and all for the simple reason that he made children happy .
#Text=The Caves of the Daemons are five in number .
#Text=A broad pathway leads up to the first cave , which is a finely arched cavern at the foot of the mountain , the entrance being beautifully carved and decorated .
#Text=In it resides the Daemon of Selfishness .
#Text=Back of this is another cavern inhabited by the Daemon of Envy .
#Text=The cave of the Daemon of Hatred is next in order , and through this one passes to the home of the Daemon of Malice -- situated in a dark and fearful cave in the very heart of the mountain .
#Text=I do not know what lies beyond this .
#Text=Some say there are terrible pitfalls leading to death and destruction , and this may very well be true .
#Text=However , from each one of the four caves mentioned there is a small , narrow tunnel leading to the fifth cave -- a cozy little room occupied by the Daemon of Repentance .

#Text=And as the rocky floors of these passages are well worn by the track of passing feet , I judge that many wanderers in the Caves of the Daemons have escaped through the tunnels to the abode of the Daemon of Repentance , who is said to be a pleasant sort of fellow who gladly opens for one a little door admitting you into fresh air and sunshine again .
#Text=Well , these Daemons of the Caves , thinking they had great cause to dislike old Santa Claus , held a meeting one day to discuss the matter .
#Text=" I 'm really getting lonesome , " said the Daemon of Selfishness .
#Text=" For Santa Claus distributes so many pretty Christmas gifts to all the children that they become happy and generous , through his example , and keep away from my cave . "
#Text=" I 'm having the same trouble , " rejoined the Daemon of Envy .
#Text=" The little ones seem quite content with Santa Claus , and there are few , indeed , that I can coax to become envious . "
#Text=" And that makes it bad for me ! " declared the Daemon of Hatred .
#Text=" For if no children pass through the Caves of Selfishness and Envy , none can get to MY cavern . "
#Text=" Or to mine , " added the Daemon of Malice .
#Text=" For my part , " said the Daemon of Repentance , " it is easily seen that if children do not visit your caves they have no need to visit mine ; so that I am quite as neglected as you are . "
#Text=" And all because of this person they call Santa Claus ! " exclaimed the Daemon of Envy .
#Text=" He is simply ruining our business , and something must be done at once . "
#Text=To this they readily agreed ; but what to do was another and more difficult matter to settle .

#Text=They knew that Santa Claus worked all through the year at his castle in the Laughing Valley , preparing the gifts he was to distribute on Christmas Eve ; and at first they resolved to try to tempt him into their caves , that they might lead him on to the terrible pitfalls that ended in destruction .
#Text=So the very next day , while Santa Claus was busily at work , surrounded by his little band of assistants , the Daemon of Selfishness came to him and said :
#Text=" These toys are wonderfully bright and pretty .

#Text=It 's a pity to give them to those noisy boys and fretful girls , who break and destroy them so quickly .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Nonsense ! " cried the old graybeard , his bright eyes twinkling merrily as he turned toward the tempting Daemon .

column1: #Text=" The boys and girls are never so noisy and fretful after receiving my presents , and if I can make them happy for one day in the year I am quite content . "
#Text=So the Daemon went back to the others , who awaited him in their caves , and said :
#Text=" I have failed , for Santa Claus is not at all selfish . "
#Text=The following day the Daemon of Envy visited Santa Claus .
#Text=Said he :
#Text=" The toy shops are full of playthings quite as pretty as those you are making .

#Text=They make toys by machinery much quicker than you can make them by hand ; and they sell them for money , while you get nothing at all for your work .
